==Location and elements==
==Location and elements==
â
+
[[File:Ogawa Plaza.png|left|thumb|Ogawa plaza]]
Frank H. Ogawa Plaza is located where Telegraph and San Pablo Avenues converge with Broadway and 14th Street. The west side of the plaza is the site of [[Oakland City Hall]] and [[Oakland Police Department|Oakland Police]] Headquarters. Around the plaza are several [[Beaux-Arts architecture|Beaux-Arts]] styled commercial buildings from the early 20th century.<ref>{{cite book|last=Dinkelspiel Cerny|first=Susan|title=An Architectural Guidebook to San Francisco and the Bay Area|year=2007|publisher=Gibbs Smith|isbn=9781586854324|page=247}}</ref> New buildings have been constructed to fit visually with the older architecture.<ref>{{cite book|title=Fentress Bradburn: Selected and Current Works|year=1998|publisher=Images Publishing|isbn=9781875498864|page=188}}</ref>
Frank H. Ogawa Plaza is located where Telegraph and San Pablo Avenues converge with Broadway and 14th Street. The west side of the plaza is the site of [[Oakland City Hall]] and [[Oakland Police Department|Oakland Police]] Headquarters. Around the plaza are several [[Beaux-Arts architecture|Beaux-Arts]] styled commercial buildings from the early 20th century.<ref>{{cite book|last=Dinkelspiel Cerny|first=Susan|title=An Architectural Guidebook to San Francisco and the Bay Area|year=2007|publisher=Gibbs Smith|isbn=9781586854324|page=247}}</ref> New buildings have been constructed to fit visually with the older architecture.<ref>{{cite book|title=Fentress Bradburn: Selected and Current Works|year=1998|publisher=Images Publishing|isbn=9781875498864|page=188}}</ref>
